data.event: Santos (Portuguese pronunciation: [ˈsɐ̃tus], Saints) is a municipality in the São Paulo state of Brazil, founded in 1546 by the Portuguese nobleman Brás Cubas.
Exportation and importation through its port have made it the modern city one finds today and turned it into the indispensable outlet for the production of the powerhouse that is São Paulo State.
In 1924, it became the seat of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Santos.
